author: Emma Powell
title: Lena Dunham claims 'soul-crushing pain' of Donald Trump's election made her lose weight

locations.name: trump tower drew angerer/getty images  kanye west

text:
Lena Dunham claims ‘soul-crushing pain’ of Donald Trump's election made her lose weight 
The actress said she has been unable to stomach food Tuesday 7 February 2017 11:22 GMT Click to followES Entertainment New look: Lena Dunham claims Trump aided her weight loss Jamie McCarthy/Getty 
Lena Dunham has revealed she was so traumatised by Donald Trump ’s Presidential success that she couldn’t eat. 
The Girls creator, 30, claimed she has lost weight following his triumph over Hillary Clinton last November. 
Speaking about her slimmer figure on Howard Stern ’s SiriusXM radio show, she said: “Donald Trump became president and I stopped being able to eat food. 
“Everyone’s been asking like, ‘What have you been doing?’ And I’m like, ‘Try soul-crushing pain and devastation and hopelessness and you, too, will lose weight.'” Group photo: Lena Dunham with Girls co-stars Zosia Mamet, Allison Williams and Jemima Kirke (Jamie McCarthy/Getty) 
Dunham – who was on the show to promote the final series of her hit show Girls – also spoke about her war of words with the Republican and his focus on celebrities. 
“[Trump] said I was a B-list actor with no mojo. Here’s the funny thing. Of course, it’s a mistake,” she said. 
“But we’re talking about him like he’s a person who is operating in a sane way. We’re talking about him like a person who doesn’t have a personality disorder." Kanye West meets Donald Trump - In pictures Kanye West meets Donald Trump - In pictures 1/6 
U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and musician Kanye West pose for media at Trump Tower in Manhattan Andrew Kelly/Reuters 2/6 
President-elect Donald Trump and Kanye West stand together in the lobby at Trump Tower in New York Drew Angerer/Getty Images 3/6 
Singer Kanye West and President-elect Donald Trump leave the elevator after their meeting at Trump Tower Timothy A.Clary/AFP/Getty Images 4/6 
Singer Kanye West and President-elect Donald Trump arrive to speak with the press after their meetings at Trump Towe Timothy A.Clary/AFP/Getty Images 
President-elect Donald Trump pats Kanye West on the back in the lobby at Trump Tower Drew Angerer/Getty Images 
Kanye West arrives at Trump Tower in Manhattan Jihn Taggart/EPA 
Dunham – who publicly backed Clinton – also explained why she isn’t planning to relocate to Canada, despite promising to do so if Mr Trump was elected as President. 
The move was backed by Mr Trump himself who said last April: “That would be a great, great thing for our country if she got out.” Read more
